page.title: 03Multi-coloured Grass
page.content: On the 15th of August 1984 at 7.30pm a lorry carrying dye was going south on the A74 at Johnstonebridge . Its tyre blew off and the lorry went across the central reservation and diagonally into a house. The cabin ended up in the living room.The driver was badly hurt. Luckily the occupants of the house were in the kitchen at the time. The blue and purple dye was in containers which burst and the dye went everywhere in the room and beyond. This left purple and blue furniture and even the grass outside was purple and blue. When the lorry had stopped the engine was still running so a local man switched it off. It was very lucky that the lorry did not hit the nearby filling station and cause an explosion.
